content: honeycomb brioche hat by sara baldwin ©2025 this hat is based on double brioche stitch sometimes known as honeycomb brioche this stitch makes a soft and fluffy fabric which is lovely for hats brioche stitch is naturally very loose so i like to tighten the gauge up a bit by going to smaller needles that way the hat will be more windproof and less likely to develop snags and pulls abbreviations st stitch k knit s slip the next stitch as if to purl s1yo yarn over wrap the working yarn counterclockwise around the right needle from front to back and pass the next stitch onto the rh needle as if to purl k2tog knit 2 together k3tog knit 3 together including all yarn overs brk1 knit the next stitch together with its yarnover pm place marker sm slip marker size this pattern makes a stretchy hat about 18 inches in diameter it will fit most adults materials five double pointed knitting needles size #4 and one 16 inch circular needle of the same size as your double pointed needles yarn any worsted weight yarn in two colors for the model i used yarn bee chromatic spectrum in color a 03 it s an azure thing color b 05 island life knitting markers darning needle with color a cast on 73 stitches or any number divisible by 4 plus one extra loosely on your circular needle join by knitting the last stitch together with the first stitch being careful not to twist place a marker at the beginning of the round to make a narrow band knit eight rounds or four ridges of garter stitch knit 1 round purl 1 round before you go any farther it is always a good idea to stretch your hat to make sure the cast on edge will fit over your head don t ask me how i know this drop color a and pick up color b prep row with color b s1yo k 1 to marker drop b and pick up a henceforth when changing colors at the end of each round pick up the new color underneath the old so as not to leave a hole round 1 color a k1 by reaching under the yo from the previous round then s1 k2 around end k1 sm round 2 color b brk1 s1yo brk1 around end s1yo round 3 color a k2 slip the yo as if to purl around remember that you will have to reach under the yo from the previous round to reach that second knit stitch round 4 color b brk1 s1yo around end brk1 repeat rounds 1-4 until the hat measures about 6 inches from the lower edge ending with round 2 now knit round 3 and divide the stitches on your needle into four sections place markers to separate these markers should be a different color from your end-of-round marker the markers should be placed between the yarnovers and your next knit
